content.description: Several fun moderate variations to get the most out of a session on a small boulder!Either:Stand start matched on the big triangular feature and reach out left to the pinch on The Joker and top out in that scoop ~V2ishOrStand start with your left hand on the triangular feature and your right hand on a crimpy sidepull at head height in the middle of the face. Get a high foot, bump your right hand to another sidepull and your left around the left side of the arete then go for the top. ~v3ish (This variation also goes as a 1 move dyno if youre feeling silly ~V4ish)
content.location: On the tallest face, look for the big triangular feature. you can't miss it

content.description: Sit start on two small crimps on the large side facing the parking area. Use the bad feet and smearing to hit a few small crimps before reaching the top jug.
content.location: Walk from the parking to the large flat face.

content.description: Sit starts with left hand on a crimp right hand on the low horn. Quick bumps with hands will allow you to swing a right foot up and around the boulder. A little bit of a reach to the last hold.
content.location: Located on the lower right side of the large face that can be seen from the parking area.

content.description: Start low next to small arete, a few bumped hands and high feet onto a quick topout.
content.location: Right corner of the side facing the road.

content.description: A nice easy warm up on the back side. Multiple starting hands available. Climb left for variation or climb right into a quick topout. This also acts as the downclimb for the other routes. The way you end doesn't change the grade much, so I just included both in the photo.
content.location: Back side that faces away from the road.

content.description: Starts with hands on a shelf with decent feet. Start is located around the left corner of the face. Traverse right onto the large face and use the high jug to pull yourself up.
content.location: Starts on corner of the side farthest from the road and the large face that views the parking.

content.description: Start as for The Thief, but instead of tossing a foot around the corner and rocking over onto the slab, use the big horn feature and the broad pinches on the upper part of the arete to work your way to the top sort-of laybacking the arete. Figure out some tricky feet to get up to the arete and then get rewarded by some of the best movement on this boulder.
content.location: Start on the right corner of the tallest face on the boulder, same start as The Thief. Starting holds are a crimp for your left hand and an incut edge of the horn for your right hand. Climb directly up the arete and top out at the highest point in the middle of the face.

content.description: Start on the backside of the boulder on the far left edge. Step on and traverse using slopers across the lip and minimal feet until you arrive at a great foot and the corner. Use the juggy sloper at the corner and the corner itself to mantle up. Finally take a step up to top out.
content.location: The start is the rounded NE corner of the boulder. Start to the left of the witch hazel shrub that leans over the boulder, traversing under it when feet are minimal might be the crux.

content.description: Short two move problem on the back side of boulder hidden from the road. Sit start low and big move to sloper that also acts as a high heel. Mantle out onto the top.
content.location: The side opposite of the road. Around the middle of the boulder.

content.description: This boulder hugs the road and is hard to miss. Large face is best quality on the boulder but the short sides have a few Ffun-V1 options.
